paper.title: Human-Machine Interaction and Role/Function/Action-Nets
paper.venue: Proceedings of an Advanced Course on Petri Nets: Central Models and Their Properties, Advances in Petri Nets 1986-Part II
paper.abstract: Descriptions of human-machine systems should reflect the useru0027s perspective to be helpful for understanding her/his work-environment and for building up mental models needed for human-machine interaction (HMI). A conceptual framework for HMI is presented. It characterizes computer-supported work on three levels: on the first two levels in terms of co-operating roles played by human role players and in terms of functions which may be performed by persons or machines as actors. The dynamics are treated on a third level, called the action level.
